page.title: 16PLAYGROYND AT ASHTON ROAD
page.content: The playground on Ashton Road was created about four years ago on the site of a disused factory. The lower walls of the factory were retained to surround the playspace and the inside surfaces of the walls have been brightly painted. The outer surfaces are very unsightly and resemble a ruined industrial building. Inside the playground there are facilities for children of all ages - a slide, swings and areas for games such as football and cricket. Unfortunately, the area is not very well maintained, and the whole of the ground is littered with loose stones and broken glass. The high surrounding walls do provide cover for the badly behaved, especially on dark evenings, and this has caused friction with local people who live close by.
